text.p: These are the leading stories in the Zambian press on Wednesday.
Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- General workers at Zambia's biggest hospital go on strike to push for a 30,000 kwacha pay rise.
- Lecturers at the University of Zambia tell a commission investigating student unrest that the vice chancellor and his deputy had abused their positions and should be dismissed.
- Zambia cannot access its quota of a $18 billion fund from international donors because it has failed to ratify the Lome IV convention due to government inertia.
- The Zambia Revenue Authority records an increase in value added tax compliance following the introduction of a 0.5 percent penalty for delayed payment.
- A 13-year-old girl who sued her father for assault drops her case.
- The drug enforcement commission arrests a Zimbabwean for trafficking in hashish.
